key_work.title: Since I Left You – The Avalanches
key_work.brief_description: Directed by Rob Leggatt and Leigh Marling, The Avalanches’ ‘Since I Left You’ manages to combine familiar pop culture touchstones like Flashdance (1983) with the utterly surreal as two miners burrow through a black and white world into full colour.

links.description: Hell’s Club is part of a long moving image tradition of remixing and repurposing content to create new meaning and perspectives. One of the first instances was Charles A Ridley’s Schichlegruber - Doing the Lambeth Walk (1941), which ridiculed Nazis by soundtracking their propaganda videos with a jaunty tune.

constellations_other.name: Great southern land?
constellations_other.description: Australia is often mythologised in film and TV, but national myths must not only be embraced, but resisted.

links.description: Artist duo and remix maestros Soda_Jerk took their penchant for reappropriating iconic cinema characters to new levels in TERROR NULLIUS, their 2018 artwork commissioned by ACMI. Rather than a celebration like ‘The Was’, TERROR NULLIUS is a condemnation of mainstream Australian identity.
